definition: to make up for an earlier mistake/to make amends
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Some planks are patched and warped. Several bottom skids are broken.
sentences.chinese: 一些板子補過並彎翹了，幾根底梁斷了。

sentences.english: It was hard for me to ask for a change, so I just went ahead.
sentences.chinese: 再改過去很難，我只好將功補過。

sentences.english: And old shoes and clouted upon their feet, and old garments upon them;
sentences.chinese: 將補過的舊鞋穿在腳上，把舊衣服穿在身上。

sentences.english: Now he might get at least two chances to make amends .
sentences.chinese: 現在他至少可以有兩次機會可以將功補過。

sentences.english: How many teeth have you had filled in the past two years ?
sentences.chinese: 在過去的兩年裏你補過多少顆牙齒？

sentences.english: The pair redeemed themselves in some style 10 minutes into the second half.
sentences.chinese: 下半時十分鐘，二人將功補過。

sentences.english: We should let them make up for their mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當讓他們將功補過。

sentences.english: He has a chance to make things right.
The men put worn and patched sandals on their feet and wore old clothes.
sentences.chinese: 將補過的舊鞋穿在腳上，把舊衣服穿在身上。

sentences.english: The little spot of gold in the dirt is a molar with a gold filling.
sentences.chinese: 泥土裏那小小的金光是一顆用金子補過的磨牙。

sentences.english: Next to it surface two more molars with silver amalgam fillings.
sentences.chinese: 在它旁邊還有幾顆用銀補過的磨牙。

sentences.english: We should let him make up for his mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當讓他將功補過。

sentences.english: Note the mend the primary color with winter there is a big difference.
sentences.chinese: 注意補過的地方顏色與硯的原色有很大的差異。

sentences.english: I am sure your dad has caught bluefish tuna before right?
sentences.chinese: 那你爸一定有補過黑鮪魚吧？
